Gross profit rose to $1.24M from $1.16M in the prior year, improving gross margin to 42.4% from 39.3%. Net loss narrowed slightly to $0.65M from $0.69M a year earlier. Adjusted EBITDA improved sequentially to ($0.35M) from ($0.42M) in Q2 but was flat year-over-year. Cost of revenues decreased due to lower materials and depreciation expenses. SG&A expenses increased slightly to $1.96M. Cash on hand was $938K, with an additional $920K in restricted cash from a $1M non-dilutive capital infusion from STADA to support upcoming product launches and marketing. Management highlighted momentum in contract manufacturing, including partnerships such as Cintas, as well as traction in consumer beauty and skincare product launches.
column22:
1) Improved gross margin year-over-year (42.4% vs. 39.3%) indicates stronger operational efficiency.  
2) Adjusted EBITDA improved sequentially, showing better cost control.  
3) Growth in contract manufacturing supported by strong partnerships (e.g., Cintas) and new global customers.  
4) $1M non-dilutive funding from STADA provides liquidity and supports product launches.
column23:
1) Revenue remains flat year-over-year and sequentially, signaling limited top-line growth.  
2) Net loss and EBITDA remain negative, reflecting ongoing unprofitability.  
3) Cash balance is low at $938K, raising liquidity concerns absent continued external funding.  
4) SG&A expenses increased despite stagnant revenue, limiting operating leverage.

column5: American Integrity Insurance Group, Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
column21: Reported Q3 2025 net income of $13.2M, or $0.67 per diluted share, with adjusted net income of $14.0M, or $0.71 per share. Gross premiums written rose 48.5% to $239.1M, and policies-in-force grew 48.6% to 406,094. Net premiums earned increased 28.5% to $52.0M, while the combined ratio improved sharply to 78.9% from 94.3% a year earlier, driven by lower loss and expense ratios. Net investment income climbed 83.8% to $6.9M. The company assumed 1,891 policies from Citizens and benefited from a stable catastrophe environment and favorable Florida legislative reforms. Policy acquisition expenses fell 19.7%, and shareholders’ equity rose to $315.9M, boosted by IPO proceeds and year-to-date profits. Annualized ROE reached 17.0%, up from 11.9% in Q3 2024.
column22:
1) Strong premium growth (+48.5%) and policy count expansion (+48.6%) indicate accelerating market penetration.  
2) Combined ratio improvement to 78.9% reflects significantly better underwriting profitability.  
3) Net investment income up 83.8% due to higher invested assets post-IPO.  
4) Expansion into new markets (Tri-County region, commercial residential) sets up continued growth into 2026.
column23:
1) Ceded premiums increased 36.1%, reflecting heavier dependence on reinsurance.  
2) Loss and LAE expenses rose 18.5%, partly offsetting underwriting gains.  
3) Higher operating costs tied to public company readiness signal rising expense pressure.  
4) Effective tax expenses increased due to transition from LLC to C-Corp structure.

column5: iFabric Corp Delivers Record Q3 2025 Revenue of $9.0 Million, up 111% Year-Over-Year
column21: Delivered record Q3 2025 revenue of $9.0M, up 111% year-over-year, driven by strong demand for technology-enhanced apparel and new customer programs, particularly in the Intelligent Fabric Division, which grew 170% to $6.9M. Intimate Apparel revenue rose 22% to $2.1M. Gross profit increased 55% to $2.73M, though gross margin declined to 30% due to U.S. tariffs, higher-volume/lower-margin product mix, and upfront ERP implementation costs. SG&A rose 20% to $2.09M from increased personnel, regulatory, and growth-related expenses. Adjusted EBITDA improved sharply to $850K from a loss in the prior year. Net earnings reached $544K ($0.018/share), compared to a $106K loss last year. Working capital increased to $19.9M, while cash decreased to $1.23M due to deposits for future inventory. Year-to-date revenue rose 30% to $21.9M, with Intelligent Fabrics up 49%.
column22:
1) Triple-digit revenue growth (+111%) signals a major scale-up and strong customer demand.  
2) Intelligent Fabric Division growth (+170%) highlights adoption of higher-value proprietary technologies.  
3) Sharp EBITDA turnaround from negative to $850K indicates improving operational leverage.  
4) Continued expansion of major customer programs supports visibility into Q4 and 2026 growth.
column23:
1) Gross margin decline (41% → 30%) reflects tariff headwinds and lower-margin product mix.  
2) Cash position fell by more than 50% due to increased inventory deposits, creating short-term liquidity pressure.  
3) SG&A up 20% from hiring and ERP costs, weighing on profitability.  
4) Adjusted EBITDA for the nine-month period declined year-over-year, suggesting margin compression despite revenue growth.

column5: FTC Solar Announces Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
column21: Reported third-quarter 2025 revenue of $26.0 million, up 156.8% year-over-year and 30.2% sequentially, exceeding guidance. GAAP gross profit was $1.6 million (6.1% margin) versus a gross loss of $3.9 million in the prior quarter; Non-GAAP gross profit was $2.0 million (7.7% margin), marking the first positive gross margin since late 2023. GAAP net loss was $23.9 million ($1.61 per share), with Non-GAAP adjusted EBITDA loss of $4.0 million, the lowest since 2020. Secured a $75 million strategic financing facility, closing $37.5 million. Announced a 1GW solar tracker supply agreement with Levona Renewables, starting with a 140MW Texas project. Purchased full ownership of Alpha Steel, LLC to enhance domestic component manufacturing. Fourth-quarter revenue expected to increase approximately 25% sequentially, reflecting continued growth momentum.

4) Forward guidance depends on continued project development and financing, which may be affected by macroeconomic or regulatory factors.

column5: RADCOM Delivers 16% YoY Revenue Growth and Strong Margin Expansion in Q3 2025

column5: DAVIDsTEA Announces $3.0 Million Private Placement and $2.7 Million Revenue-Linked Financing
column21: Announced a $3.0 million private placement, with $1.5 million subscribed by Pembroke funds and $1.5 million by Chair Jane Silverstone Segal, along with a $2.7 million revenue-linked non-dilutive financing. column5: Creative Realities Reports Fiscal 2025 Third Quarter Results
column21: Reported third quarter fiscal 2025 revenue of $10.5 million, down from $14.4 million in the prior-year period, with a gross profit of $4.8 million versus $6.6 million previously. column5: Sypris Reports Third Quarter Results
column21: Reported third quarter 2025 revenue of $28.7 million, down from $35.7 million in the prior-year period, with net income of $0.5 million, or $0.02 per diluted share, compared to $0.4 million, or $0.02 per share last year. Sypris Technologies revenue fell to $11.5 million from $19.5 million due to a commercial vehicle market downturn, tariff impacts, and inventory adjustments, while gross profit declined to $0.9 million (7.5%). Sypris Electronics revenue rose slightly to $17.1 million from $16.2 million due to program ramp-ups, with gross profit of $1.2 million (6.9%). 4) Exposure to emerging energy markets (LNG, AI data centers, CO2 capture) creates potential for revenue diversification and long-term growth.

2) Gross margins compressed in both Sypris Technologies (7.5%) and Electronics (6.9%), highlighting operational inefficiencies and cost pressures.  
3) Nine-month net loss of $2.4 million reflects ongoing macroeconomic and market headwinds.

column5: Sensus Healthcare Appoints Eric Sachetta to its Board of Directors
column21: Appointed Eric Sachetta to its Board of Directors to fill the vacancy left by the passing of long-serving Director Bill McCall. column5: BQE Water Commences Routine Operation of New Selen-IX™ Plant in Record Time at the Wharf Mine
column21: BQE Water successfully commenced routine operation of a new full-scale Selen-IX™ water treatment plant at the Coeur Wharf mine in South Dakota, USA. The plant was implemented in a record 20 months from design engineering kickoff to on-spec water discharge. It treats 150–400 gallons per minute, removing selenium to below 5 ppb. The plant passed performance tests at minimum, nominal, and maximum flow rates, including artificially elevated selenium levels, and has entered long-term routine operations with BQE Water support.
column22:
1) Record implementation time of 20 months highlights BQE Water’s operational efficiency and project execution capability.  
2) Plant effectively removes selenium to <5 ppb across variable flows and concentrations, demonstrating technology reliability.  
3) Selen-IX™ technology chosen over biological systems for operational flexibility, cold-temperature performance, and reduced residue management costs.  
4) Long-term partnership with Coeur Mining ensures ongoing compliance and environmental performance monitoring.
column23:
1) While operational, potential risks include technology performance under unforeseen extreme conditions.  
2) Reliance on continued collaboration with Coeur Mining and adherence to regulatory requirements is critical.  
3) Forward-looking statements suggest dependence on successful scaling of Selen-IX™ technology for future growth and profitability.  
4) Market or environmental changes could affect deployment timelines or operational outcomes at future sites.

column5: Qualstar Corporation Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results

column5: Interpace Biosciences Announces Third Quarter 2025 Financial and Business Results
column21: Reported third quarter 2025 revenue of $8.8 million, with cash collections of $10.0 million. column5: Journey Medical Corporation Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results and Recent Corporate Highlights

column5: Interlink Electronics Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results

column5: IZEA Extends Profitability Momentum in Q3 2025 with $8.1 Million in Revenue

column5: Ampco-Pittsburgh Corporation (NYSE: AP) Announces Third Quarter 2025 Results
column21: Reported Q3 2025 results with net sales of $108.0 million, up from $96.2 million in Q3 2024, driven by higher shipment volumes in the Air and Liquid Processing segment and stronger net pricing in Forged Engineered Products. GAAP operating income was $1.1 million, while net loss was $2.2 million, or $0.11 per share, including $3.1 million in non-cash charges for accelerated depreciation and exit costs from U.K. cast roll and a domestic steel distribution business. Adjusted EBITDA rose 35% to $9.2 million, and adjusted EPS was $0.04, up $0.14 year-over-year. The company expects a $7–8 million annual EBITDA improvement after completing the U.K. exit. Nine-month sales were $325.4 million with net loss of $8.4 million, impacted by $9.8 million of exit-related costs. Operationally, higher margins and volume in both segments supported improved adjusted results despite GAAP losses.

4) Adjusted EPS increase of $0.14 YoY shows meaningful improvement in profitability on a non-GAAP basis.

column5: RIWI Releases Q3 2025 Financials
column21: Reported Q3 2025 results with revenue of $1.44 million, up 36% from $1.06 million in Q3 2024, driven by transaction revenue of $669K, recurring revenue of $356K, and project-based revenue of $416K. Twelve-month trailing revenue reached a record $6.42 million. The company recorded a net loss of $247K, improving from a $393K loss last year, and an operating loss of $234K versus $396K previously. Platform enhancements, including a video diary solution, AI-based translation for surveys, and AI quick-quote tools, were introduced to accelerate project timelines and improve customer experience. column5: Silvaco Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
column21: Silvaco reported record Q3 2025 revenue of $18.7 million, up 70% YoY, and gross bookings of $22.8 million, up 131% YoY. Revenue growth was driven primarily by EDA software (+294% YoY to $10.4M) and TCAD (+1% YoY to $6.5M), while SIP revenue declined slightly by 6% to $1.7M. GAAP gross margin improved to 77.9%, though high operating expenses led to a GAAP operating loss of $9.3 million. GAAP net loss narrowed to $5.3 million (EPS: $0.18) from $6.6 million (EPS: $0.23) in Q3 2024. Non-GAAP operating loss was $2.3 million, and non-GAAP net loss was $2.1 million (EPS: $0.07). Silvaco implemented a cost reduction program expected to lower annualized non-GAAP operating expenses by at least $15 million. Key customer wins included adoption of Silvaco’s DTCO flow, Victory TCAD 3D simulation, and Jivaro parasitics tool. Cash, cash equivalents, short-term marketable securities, and restricted cash totaled $27.8 million at quarter-end. Guidance for Q4 2025 projects bookings of $15–19 million, revenue of $14–18 million, non-GAAP gross margin of 78–82%, and non-GAAP operating expenses of $16–18 million.
column22:
1) Achieved record revenue and gross bookings, indicating strong demand across EDA and TCAD solutions.
2) Non-GAAP operating loss decreased slightly, reflecting early impact of cost reduction measures.
3) Key customer wins and adoption of Silvaco’s advanced tools demonstrate product-market fit and potential for long-term growth.
4) Healthy cash position of $27.8 million supports ongoing operations and strategic investments.
column23:
1) GAAP operating loss of $9.3 million highlights high operating costs despite record revenue.
2) SIP revenue declined 6% YoY, indicating potential softness in that segment.
3) Non-GAAP net loss of $2.1 million and diluted EPS of $0.07 show the company is still not profitable.
4) Q4 guidance depends on execution of cost reductions and bookings trends; risk remains if market conditions soften or cost targets are not fully realized.

column5: Tecogen Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
column21: Tecogen reported Q3 2025 revenues of $7.18 million, up 27.6% YoY from $5.63 million, driven primarily by a 114.5% increase in Products revenue ($2.98 million) from higher chiller, cogeneration, and engineered accessory sales. column5: WELL Health Provides Corporate Update on WELLSTAR Reflecting Organic and Inorganic Growth Wins
column21: OceanMD, WELLSTAR’s eReferral platform, secured a major provincial contract, increasing WELLSTAR’s annual recurring revenue (ARR) by 16%. column5: Delcath Systems Announces Publication of Real-World Evidence Supporting Early Use of Liver-Directed Therapy with PHP in Achieving Long-Term Survival for Metastatic Uveal Melanoma Patients
column21: Published results from a retrospective real-world analysis of 167 metastatic uveal melanoma (mUM) patients with liver metastases, highlighting the benefits of early liver-directed therapy, including percutaneous hepatic perfusion (PHP) using Delcath’s CHEMOSAT system. Among 33 long-term survivors (≥3 years), 82% received liver-directed therapy as first-line treatment. First-line liver-directed therapy showed a 93% disease control rate versus 63% for systemic therapy. PHP recipients achieved 100% disease control when used first-line, with 69% partial response, median overall survival of 37.35 months, and median progression-free survival of 10.28 months. The study suggests combining PHP with immune checkpoint inhibitors may improve outcomes, leveraging PHP for hepatic metastases and ICI for extrahepatic disease. These findings support early integration of Delcath’s HEPZATO KIT and CHEMOSAT as part of multimodal treatment strategies for mUM patients.

4) Data reinforces potential expansion of PHP use in multimodal strategies, which may increase clinical adoption and revenue opportunities.

2) Operating profit for the full year declined ($3.735 million vs. $7.059 million prior year), reflecting prior-year lease gains that are non-recurring.
3) Other expenses related to management separations and sublease losses indicate some operational restructuring and potential integration risk at IQTalent.

column5: BioSyent Releases Financial Results for Q3 and YTD 2025
column21:
Financial Summary
1) Sales: Q3 2025 total company sales of CAD $12.22 million vs. CAD $9.56 million in Q3 2024 (+28%). Growth was driven by strong Canadian pharma sales (+19%), international pharma sales (+94%), and legacy business (+83%), reflecting successful product performance and the recent acquisition of Tibella® / Tibelia®.
2) EBITDA: Q3 2025 EBITDA of CAD $3.63 million vs. CAD $2.86 million in Q3 2024 (+27%)
3) EPS: Q3 2025 EPS of CAD $0.23 vs. CAD $0.19 in Q3 2024 (+19%)

Operational Summary
1) Management highlighted that “each of our three businesses performed well during the quarter,” and maintained EBITDA margin at ~30% despite some gross margin compression from sales mix changes.
2) FeraMAX® and Tibella® / Tibelia® products continue to generate profitable sales growth in Canada and internationally, with Tibella® / Tibelia® performing in line with expectations since acquisition in September 2024.
3) Company remains focused on continued profitable growth and momentum through year-end 2025 and into 2026, supported by NCIB share repurchases (19,500 shares YTD) and regular quarterly dividends.
column22:
1) Strong sales growth across all business units, especially international pharma (+94% Q3) and legacy business (+83%), demonstrating effective commercialization and successful integration of acquired products.
2) Consistent EBITDA margins (~30% in Q3, 29% YTD) despite sales mix changes, showing disciplined cost management.
3) Ongoing shareholder returns through NCIB repurchases and quarterly dividends, indicating confidence in cash flow and financial stability.
column23:
1) Gross margin compression noted due to sales mix changes, which could pressure future profitability if trends continue.
2) Reliance on recent acquisitions like Tibella® / Tibelia® for incremental growth, which introduces integration and execution risk.
3) International sales, while high-growth percentage-wise, are small in absolute terms (CAD $1.15 million in Q3), making them sensitive to market or regulatory fluctuations.

column5: Thermal Energy International Inc. Receives an Additional $1.6 Million Order to Deliver Customized HeatSponge Heat Recovery Units to the Arctic
column21:
1) Thermal Energy International received a $1.6M order for eight custom HeatSponge heat recovery units for an Arctic mining operation, following a prior $400k order for two units, highlighting repeat business with a strategic customer.  
2) CEO William Crossland emphasized the technical complexity of the project, stating the units are engineered to handle extreme reciprocating engine conditions with high heat, pressure, and vibration, where previous heat exchangers were failing.  
3) BEI President Vincent Sands noted the project demonstrates the company's commitment to solving complex energy challenges in extreme environments, emphasizing resilience and sustainability.  
4) The project uses modular, match-marked components for transport by standard cargo aircraft and plug-and-play assembly on-site, enabling rapid installation without specialized contractors, while delivering a 22% efficiency boost and durable, leak-proof design tailored to site constraints.
column22:
1) Repeat order from the same Arctic mining customer indicates strong client trust and potential for ongoing strategic contracts.  
2) Innovative modular and plug-and-play design enhances operational scalability and positions the company as a problem solver in extreme environments.  
3) 22% efficiency boost and durable design may strengthen Thermal Energy's reputation for technically advanced, high-value solutions.
column23:
1) Project execution is logistically challenging due to Arctic access constraints, with potential delays if transport or on-site assembly issues arise.  
2) Installation must occur within narrow windows, increasing operational risk and reliance on client staff without specialized support.  
3) Dependence on a single large customer for a high-value order may expose the company to concentration risk.

column5: WELL Health Reports Strong Organic Growth, Major Advances in Clinic Digitization, and Rapid Progress on New Primary Care Patient Openings
column21:
1) WELL reported that same-clinic organic growth reached 10% in primary care and 16% in diagnostics, with absorption growth contributing additional uplift, and the company highlighted new enhanced disclosure showing how organic growth is being generated across WMC and WDC.
2) Management disclosed that 92% of clinics older than nine months have achieved "core digitization" — defined by four usage-based digital workflows — and stated that the goal is for every clinic to hit this standard within one year, with the definition likely expanding as AI tools roll out.
3) WELL said it created over 45,000 new primary care patient openings across three provinces and has already filled 25,000 as of Oct. 31, expecting to fill the remainder by end of Q1 2026, supported by physician recruitment, centralized marketing, and digital intake systems designed to accelerate roster building.
column22:
1) The company is achieving high (92%) penetration of core digitization across eligible clinics, indicating strong adoption of digital workflows and a scalable operational model.
2) Rapid filling of new patient openings (25k already filled) suggests strong demand, effective marketing, and successful physician recruitment — all pointing to continued network expansion.
3) Management’s plan to expand the definition of “core digitization” with new AI tools (AI Ambient Scribe, AI Decision Support) signals ongoing operational leverage and potential future efficiency gains.
column23:
1) Absorption-driven growth at WMC is only 6%, which may indicate slower-than-expected ramping of newly added clinics or limited capacity uplift.
2) The company implies that full digitization is not yet uniform across all clinics and still requires a 12-month ramp, creating operational variability and potential integration friction as more clinics join.
3) Heavy dependence on centralized marketing and support infrastructure for physician roster building highlights a structural risk — independent physician practices may not scale efficiently without WELL’s continuous intervention.

column5: Nixxy Inc. Announces its AI-powered Sales Acceleration Platform, Leadnova.ai Enters User Acceptance Testing, Targeting Commercial Beta Launch in Q1 2026
column21:
1) Leadnova.ai has entered User Acceptance Testing, with management targeting a commercial beta launch in Q1 2026 as part of Nixxy’s broader push into the AI data market and future data monetization opportunities.  
2) CEO Mike Schmidt said the goal since acquiring the assets in Q2 2025 has been to “rapidly evolve them into a market-ready AI data product” that becomes the center of Nixxy’s ecosystem and positions the company to compete in AI-powered, data-driven customer acquisition.  
3) Management emphasized that Leadnova.ai serves as “the front door into Nixxy's AI data strategy,” enabling future opportunities such as enterprise data licensing and tokenized, data-backed value models while consolidating multiple sales outreach tools into one platform for SMBs and agencies.
column22:
1) Leadnova entering UAT with a defined Q1 2026 commercial beta timeline signals execution progress and a near-term catalyst.  
2) Management frames Leadnova as core to its AI data strategy, indicating potential high strategic value and optionality (data licensing, tokenized data models).  
3) The platform consolidates multiple sales/outreach tools into a single system, positioning it favorably for budget-constrained SMBs and agencies — a large, high-churn market hungry for efficiency.
column23:
1) Heavy dependence on integrating multiple acquired AI assets suggests execution risk, especially given the company’s rapid M&A pace in 2025.  
2) The product aims to compete in an extremely crowded AI sales automation market, raising differentiation and adoption risks despite large data access claims.  
3) No mention of existing pilot customers or committed demand means early traction remains unproven heading into UAT.

column5: NETSOL’s Transcend Retail signs two US dealer groups
column21:
1) Porsche North Houston and Jim Shorkey Nissan both deployed Transcend Retail, with Porsche completing implementation in under five weeks and five additional Porsche stores scheduled to go live by December 1, 2025.  
2) Management highlighted measurable improvements: Porsche North Houston reported “a huge influx of leads,” higher client engagement, and superior UX versus prior tools; Jim Shorkey Nissan emphasized ease of use, transparency, and strong vendor support from NETSOL.  
3) NETSOL framed these deployments as strategic momentum in North America, positioning Transcend Retail as a “modern and intelligent” platform designed to reduce friction, modernize the sales funnel, and drive back-end finance and service revenue across large dealer groups.
column22:
1) Rapid expansion pipeline: five additional Porsche dealerships are already scheduled to go live by December 1, signaling strong customer validation and near-term deployment momentum.  
2) Dealers are reporting operational uplift — including increased lead flow, higher engagement, and a smoother customer journey — which strengthens NETSOL’s competitive positioning.  
3) Management explicitly frames Transcend Retail as a strategic growth engine in North America, suggesting continued dealer adoption and deeper penetration into large auto groups.
column23:
1) No quantitative KPIs were provided to validate claims of lead increases or engagement improvements, making operational gains hard to size.  
2) Heavy reliance on customer testimonials may indicate early-stage traction still being proved out rather than established market dominance.  
3) The PR does not clarify integration challenges, onboarding costs, or scalability constraints as deployments ramp across multiple dealer groups.
